poemContent: I met a cyclist from a country road who said:One oval, hairless head, rolls down the pavement.At the top of the hill, a battered blazer lies whose sneer,And slips of late detentions, yet remain scatteredOn these weathered slabs.And on the shattered gates it reads:"My name is OzyAndyas: King of teachers and students!Look on my rules, ye naughty and obey!"Nothing besides remains, round the rusted doors and hollow walls,The lone and misty woods, stretch far away. 
